description: From Late Latin Pharisaismus, from Pharǐsaeus (“Pharisee”) + -ismus (“-ism”); compare French Pharisaïsme, Italian Fariseismo (archaic), farisaismo.

entries.meaning: The doctrines and practices, or the character and spirit, of the Pharisees.
(chiefly Christianity) Rigid observance of external forms of religion without genuine piety; hypocrisy in religion; a censorious, self-righteous spirit in matters of morals or manners.
examples: But denunciations do not go far, and the only living and effective protest would be a society itself delivered from all pharisaisms and idolatries.
